description: Collecting and processing plastic waste to create new products, reducing the environmental impact of plastic pollution.
Converting organic waste, such as food scraps and yard trimmings, into nutrient-rich compost, enriching soils and reducing landfill usage.
Responsible disposal and recycling of electronic waste, recovering valuable resources and preventing hazardous materials from entering the environment.
Transforming waste materials into new products of higher value and extended usability, promoting creativity and sustainability.
examples: Repurposing glass bottles into decorative vases
Creating fashion items from discarded textiles
Using old tires to make playground equipment

description: Safe handling and disposal of medical waste to protect healthcare workers, patients, and the environment from potential health hazards.
Collecting and recycling paper waste to save energy, water, and trees, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Collecting and processing glass waste to create new glass products, saving raw materials and reducing energy consumption.
Collecting and recycling metal waste to conserve natural resources and reduce greenhouse gas emissions associated with metal production.
Safe handling and disposal of hazardous waste, including materials that are toxic, flammable, corrosive, or reactive, to protect public health and the environment.
Reprocessing textile waste to create new clothing, accessories, or materials, reducing the demand for virgin textiles and minimizing environmental impacts.
Minimizing food waste through better management, distribution, and consumption practices, reducing methane emissions from landfills and conserving resources.
Converting organic waste, such as agricultural residues and animal waste, into renewable energy sources like biogas or biofuels.
Treating and purifying wastewater to remove pollutants and contaminants, protecting water resources and aquatic ecosystems.
Reusing or recycling construction waste, such as concrete, wood, and metal, to reduce landfill usage and conserve resources.
Proper handling and disposal of biohazard waste, including biological materials and contaminated lab equipment, to prevent the spread of infections and protect public health.
Recovering and recycling used cooking oils and greases to create biofuels or other products, preventing clogs in sewer systems and reducing environmental contamination.
Proper handling and disposal of debris from construction sites, ensuring safe and efficient waste removal.
Reusing or recycling old tires for various applications, including rubberized asphalt, playground surfaces, and rubber mats.
Generating energy from non-recyclable waste materials through various technologies like incineration, gasification, or anaerobic digestion.
Refurbishing and reusing electronic waste for extended product life, reducing electronic waste streams and conserving resources.
Recycling used batteries to recover valuable materials and prevent hazardous substances from contaminating the environment.
Promoting the use of reusable water bottles and tap water to reduce the environmental impact of single-use plastic bottles.
Creating art and craft items using recycled materials, promoting creativity and environmental awareness.
Using sustainable and recycled materials in construction to reduce environmental impact and promote energy efficiency.
Implementing strategies to minimize waste generation and divert materials from landfills, aiming for zero waste to landfills or incineration.
